Description: Sherd of rim and body of East Greek pottery plate; buff clay; cream slip on inside; two light grooves on top of rim; two suspension holes through rim; hook maeander frieze between bands on top of rim, interrupted in area of holes by washy glaze lines; red band between glaze bands at edge of floor, overlapped by an extended lotus bud in added red.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1169)
